page.description: The definition of a line group.

discussion.p: The line group draws lines between the data points in a group.

A "smooth" interpolation will draw the line as a curve. The amount will define how much the line is smoothed between points. A value of "0.5" will result in the standard "s" curve. A smaller value will result in more of a straight line between values and a larger value will increase the curviness.

A "step" interpolation will draw the line as multiple horizontal and/or vertical lines. The amount will define where the step occurs. A value of "0" will result in the step happening immediately at the data point, while a value of "1" will result in it happening at the end. A value of "0.5" will result in the step happening halfway between the two data points.

property.name: interpolation
property.description: The definition of how to draw the line between two sequential points.

property.name: type
property.description: What type of interpolation to use. Values can be "none", "smooth" (the default) or "step".

property.name: amount
property.description: A value between "0" and "1" that the interpolation type uses when drawing (the default is "0.5"). A function called with "data" (see *[link:A5.chart Render Data Object]*) and "temp" can be used to dynamically calculate the amount.

property.name: line
property.description: The line definition. See *[link:A5.chart Definition Line Object]*.

property.name: area
property.description: The setting to draw the area between the line "value" and "base".

property.name: show
property.description: If "false" (the default) then no area will be drawn. A value of "true" will draw an area.

property.name: fill
property.description: The area fill definition. See *[link:A5.chart Definition Fill Object]*.

page.note: When using the render data (see *[link:A5.chart Render Data Object]*), the "point" (if applicable) will be the current starting point. The next "point" can be gotten by using "data.group.points[data.path.point]".
